item.title: staging-next 2024-10-15
item.description:
This is the last iteration that can contain breaking changes to release-critical packages.

Helpful links

wire-desktop on Linux uses electron 29.4.5, which is known to be vulnerable to CVE-2024-6775:

https://github.com/wireapp/wire-desktop/blob/cf65edb5981be370f3284555512696175099e234/package.json#L85

The MacOS version is even older, and affected by this too.

item.title: cups-filters: remove support for legacy CUPS browsing and for LDAP
item.description:
Fixes CVE-2024-47176 / https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8 and CVE-2024-47850 / https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-filters/security/advisories/GHSA-rq86-c7g6-r2h8.

NixOS is not affected by these security issues by default because we do not ship the default configuration file so it fallbacks to BrowseRemoteProtocols dnssd.

631/udp is removed from the open firewall ports, it was by the CUPS browsing protocol.

item.title: oath-toolkit: 2.6.11 -> 2.6.12, migrate to by-name
item.description:
Migrate oath-toolkit to pkgs/by-name and update to newest version 6.1.12 which fixes a privilege escalation vulnerability in pam_oath.so (CVE-2024-47191), see https://security.opensuse.org/2024/10/04/oath-toolkit-vulnerability.html . NixOS systems are affected if security.pam.services.<name>.oathAuth is enabled.

Notifying maintainer @schnusch .

I suggest backporting this to stable.

Note: A TODO comment in the build recipe file recommends to "switch to OpenPAM" once https://gitlab.com/oath-toolkit/oath-toolkit/-/issues/26 is resolved. It is, but I cannot test the package on darwin, so I opted not to touch the darwin build configuration now.
